page.title: 04BY_PASS
page.content: As a result of the traffic jams in Okehampton which have tailed back for over fifteen miles, there has to be a{By_pass}built. It could either go through Dartmoor or it would go through the north side which is farm land. First it was going through the south side which is Dartmoor but the House Of Lords ruled that out because there is a law saying unless there is no alternative route, a trunk road cannot go through or on a National Park. We found out that if it goes on he north side it would affect Knowle bridge and Knowle quarry. People would lose their jobs. Also there would have to be an enormous viaduct over the River Okement in Brightley valley and this would spoil the lovely wooded valley.
